author: kodarn
body:
<!--

If it is a bug report:
- make sure you are able to repro it on the latest released version. 
You can install the latest version from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](../docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](../docs/KNOWNISSUES.md).
- Fill out the following repro template

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->

Steps to reproduce
------------------
OperatingSystem: MacOSX 10.12.1
1. Start PowerShell in a terminal window
2. Type: Invoke-WebRequest -Uri "https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=817244"

Expected behavior
-----------------
The file being downloaded

Actual behavior
---------------
```powershell
PS /Users/username/Documents/test> Invoke-WebRequest -Uri "https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=817244"                                                                                                             
Invoke-WebRequest : The type initializer for 'Microsoft.Win32.Registry' threw an exception.
At line:1 char:1
+ Invoke-WebRequest -Uri "https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=81724 ...
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : NotSpecified: (:) [Invoke-WebRequest], TypeInitializationException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : System.TypeInitializationException,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.InvokeWebRequestCommand
 
PS /Users/username/Documents/test> 
```
Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->
OperatingSystem: MacOSX 10.12.1
```powershell
> $PSVersionTable
Name                           Value                                                                                                                                                                                                
----                           -----                                                                                                                                                                                                
PSVersion                      6.0.0-alpha                                                                                                                                                                                          
PSEdition                      Core                                                                                                                                                                                                 
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}                                                                                                                                                                              
BuildVersion                   3.0.0.0                                                                                                                                                                                              
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-alpha.13                                                                                                                                                                                      
CLRVersion                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
WSManStackVersion              3.0                                                                                                                                                                                                  
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3                                                                                                                                                                                                  
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1                                                                                                                                                                                              

```

comments.author: kodarn
comments.body:
Tested this in v6.0.0-alpha.14, and no exception is thrown 👍 

Question: Is there any way of knowing the redirected filename? That is, when browsing to "https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=817244" we now get the file content, but have no idea what the proper filename is. I guess its stated in the http redirect headers somewhere? Should Invoke-WebRequest cmdlet handle this, or is there another way of solving this?

title: Invoke-WebRequest
